trans-unit.source: Defines a set of methods and properties used to examine a data source.

Classes that implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceSchema> class are used by custom control designer components to provide lists of views in a data source for data-bound controls at design time.

In a class that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceSchema>, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceSchema.GetViews%2A> method to get an array of IDataSourceViewSchema objects.
Gets an array representing the child views contained in the current view.
It uses its implementation of the GetChildren method to create an array of <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceViewSchema> objects.
An array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceViewSchema"></xref> objects that represent the child views contained in the current view.
Gets an array containing information about each field in the data source.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetSchema> class implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceViewSchema> interface; its implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetViewSchema.GetFields%2A> method returns an array of <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema> objects, each of which derives from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema> interface.
An array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema"></xref> objects representing each of the fields in the data source.
Gets the name of the view.
For a <xref:System.Data.DataTable> object, this property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataTable.TableName%2A> property.
